decks.notes: The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of removal spells, creatures with haste, and disruptive cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while dealing damage efficiently. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Unstoppable Slasher provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game if left unchecked. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and secure a swift victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent's creatures and life total, utilizing efficient burn spells like Boros Charm, Lightning Helix, and Play with Fire. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Hired Claw to apply pressure early in the game. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing noncreature spells, while Kumano Faces Kakkazan provides a powerful removal option. With a mix of burn, creatures, and land destruction, this deck aims to quickly eliminate the opponent's life total and secure victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan with efficient removal and hand disruption spells such as Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. Key creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. Faerie Miscreant and Spyglass Siren helps to maintain card advantage while cards like Brazen Borrower and Enduring Curiosity add versatility to the deck. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Valgavoth, Terror Eater and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance. The deck also runs a mix of removal spells and hand disruption to control the game until it can assemble its combo pieces. The Fountainport and Ziatora's Proving Ground help to fix the mana base and ensure the deck can cast its spells consistently. The deck aims to be proactive in setting up its combos while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana quickly, enabling powerful combo plays with cards like Hidden Strings, Pore Over the Pages, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands. The deck also includes various card draw and selection spells to ensure consistent access to combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the necessary components to win the game in a single explosive turn, while also having disruption and protection spells to handle opponents' threats. Overall, the deck revolves around efficiently ramping up mana and executing game-winning combos.

The deck focuses on utilizing spirits with aggressive abilities to control the board and pressure the opponent. It combines evasion, disruption, and powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The spirits work together to protect each other and further the aggression by countering spells, exiling threats, and tapping down blockers. The deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game, leveraging its disruptive elements to pave the way for aggressive spirit creatures to finish off the opponent.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero, then pump them up with spells like Infuriate and Titan's Strength to deal massive damage. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and a powerful mana source. By constantly applying pressure and leveraging the powerful abilities of your creatures, you aim to outpace and defeat your opponent before they can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, versatile creatures, and powerful planeswalkers. By using cards that can answer a variety of threats and generate card advantage, the deck aims to stabilize the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and abilities. The diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, while the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value and options for the player. This control deck thrives on outsmarting opponents and adapting to different situations.

This Aggro deck focuses on efficiently casting spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard. By including low-cost spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse, alongside cantrips like Consider and Opt, this deck can quickly fill the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower, as well as card advantage with Treasure Cruise and Profit's Eidetic Memory. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick, evasive threats and efficient spellcasting.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful card advantage and selection abilities of Niv-Mizzet Reborn to control the game and out-value the opponent. It includes a wide variety of multicolored cards to ensure that Niv-Mizzet Reborn consistently draws cards when it enters the battlefield. The deck also runs a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, for additional value and flexibility. With a mix of removal spells, ramp, and powerful threats, the key concept is to control the game, generate value, and overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and powerful game plan.
